intro: Sabulina lineata, commonly known as the slender sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is a low-growing perennial that typically thrives in sandy or gravelly soils, often found in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant features small, linear leaves and produces clusters of tiny, white or pale pink flowers. It is well adapted to harsh conditions, with a compact growth form and efficient water conservation mechanisms. Sabulina lineata is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
